result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle A. Dettman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes: Obtain or maintain full time employment.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample on 2-1-16.

Absolute sobriety - no alcohol.
Not to be in the company of any active drug users, except at an AA or NA meeting.
No illegal drugs, no prescription drugs, except according to prescription.
No contact with co-defendants, M.D. or J.M.

Continue to cooperate in cases where testimony is necessary.
Participate in and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations, and/or treatment programs required by agent.
Successfully complete a cognitive intervention program.
Pay extradition fees - to be repaid during probation.  If revoked, may come out of prison monies.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
